intro: Limonium merxmuelleri subsp. sulcitanum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in coastal areas and saline soils. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Limonium merxmuelleri subsp. sulcitanum is typically perennial and thrives in full sun.
